We examine the effects of the transformation \\( f(z) = e^{Bt} z \\) over time \\( t \\), where \\( B \\) is also a constant matrix.

If at time \\( t_1 \\), a new transformation \\( g(z) = e^{Ct}z \\) (where \\( C \\) is a different constant matrix) is applied as an intervention, will the endpoint \\( z(T) \\) for \\( T > t_1 \\) depend solely on the matrix \\( A \\), and not on \\( B \\) or \\( C \\)?
Explanation: The intervention with \\( g(z) = e^{Ct}z \\) introduces another modification to the system, making the final state \\( z(T) \\) dependent on all three matrices \\( A \\), \\( B \\), and \\( C \\). The resulting state at any point is influenced by the accumulative effects of the transformations due to compositions with evolving time.
